title: Trump and His Officials Target Fed and CDC, Long Seen as Above Politics
summary: Trump officials say the president is within his rights to fire officials who do not share his agenda.

title: RFK Jr. Sought to Fire CDC Director Susan Monarez Over Vaccine Policy
summary: The director, Susan Monarez, declined to fire agency leaders or to accept all recommendations from a vaccine advisory panel made over by Mr. Kennedy, according to people with knowledge of the events.

title: Inside the C.D.C., a Growing Sense of Despair
summary: After six months of turmoil, the loss of the new director and a round of high-profile resignations marks a new low, some employees said.

title: Texas House Advances Anti-Abortion Bill
summary: Legislation aimed at curtailing mail-order abortions in Texas cleared a decisive hurdle, part of a broader push by abortion opponents to limit the procedure even in states where it is legal.

title: Annunciation Catholic Church Reels From Deadly Minneapolis Shooting
summary: Annunciation Catholic Church and School has been a neighborhood anchor in Minneapolis for more than a century.

title: Minnesota Shooting: Students, Staff and Medical Workers Describe Acts of Heroism
summary: Students and staff members shielded the youngest children, police officers stopped victims’ bleeding, and a nurse abandoned protocol to hold a scared child’s hand.

title: A Tariff Loophole on Cheap Imports Has Closed. How Will It Affect Shoppers?
summary: The end of the “de minimis” exemption — which allowed packages less than $800 to enter the U.S. tariff-free — is leading to confusion.

title: When Mailing a Letter to the U.S. Becomes a Global Headache
summary: A driver’s license renewal, a box of specialty candy, even early Christmas presents — all are caught up in the confusion caused by a new Trump administration customs rule.

title: August in Paris: When the City Empties Out, Locals Left Behind Rejoice
summary: With many away for long vacations, the capital is transformed into a sleepy, roomy, more friendly place.

title: Trump Administration Plans Immigration Crackdown in Chicago
summary: The plans involve sending in hundreds of homeland security officers and using a naval base as a staging area.

title: Trump Signs Executive Order to Make ‘Federal Architecture Beautiful Again’
summary: The order, which affects buildings like federal courthouses and agency headquarters, encourages classical styles rather than modernist aesthetics.

title: Appeals Court Declines to Block Trump From Freezing Foreign Aid
summary: The court voted not to revisit a fight over billions in frozen funds, but simultaneously revised an earlier order to give nonprofits that sued a narrow path forward in the case.

title: Trump Officials Threaten Denver Public School Funding Over Transgender Bathroom Policy
summary: The Education Department gave Denver Public Schools 10 days to ban transgender students from using bathrooms that align with their gender identity.

title: Judge Orders New Federal Trial in Tyre Nichols Case
summary: The ruling cited concerns about the appearance of bias, pointing to comments that the judge who presided over the trial of three former police officers reportedly made afterward.

title: Mamdani Distances Himself From Democratic Socialists’ National Agenda
summary: Zohran Mamdani, the Democratic front-runner in the New York City mayor’s race, is fending off attacks that seek to link him to some of the D.S.A.’s more controversial stances.

title: Mamdani Widens Fund-Raising Lead, as Adams Is Denied Matching Funds
summary: Zohran Mamdani, the Democratic candidate for mayor of New York City, has nearly four times more campaign funds than Andrew M. Cuomo, thought to be his closest rival.

title: CVS Holds Off on Offering Covid Vaccines in 16 States
summary: The country’s largest pharmacy chain said it needed a C.D.C. panel to recommend the shots before it could offer them nationwide.

title: What to Know About Covid Vaccines This Fall
summary: The F.D.A. introduced new rules. Here’s what to know.

title: U.S. Proposes a ‘Gang-Suppression Force’ for Haiti
summary: More than a year after a contingent of Kenyan police arrived in Haiti, the United States is proposing to replace the force with something bigger and better financed.

title: Kennedy Ousted the C.D.C. Director. If Only That Were the End of It.
summary: The firing of the C.D.C. director is the latest in a series of questionable decisions.

title: Disney World Is the Happiest Place on Earth, if You Can Afford It
summary: The theme-park operator, like so many other companies, is abandoning America’s middle class.

title: China Is Trying to Expand Its Social Safety Net. Yet Many Chinese Are Worried.
summary: A move to force employers to pay into benefits for their employees has left people worrying that small businesses will close and jobs will be lost.

title: Salmonella Outbreak Linked to Eggs Sickens 95 People
summary: The outbreak, which was traced to eggs distributed in California and Nevada, has spread to 14 states, according to the C.D.C.

title: Thai Court to Rule on Paetongtarn Shinawatra’s Future in Office
summary: Paetongtarn Shinawatra is facing a legal challenge that’s seen as an important test of her powerful family’s standing with Thailand’s old guard.

title: A.K. Best, Master of the Art of Fly Tying, Is Dead at 92
summary: His meticulously crafted, lifelike designs were said to have “shaped the soul of modern fly fishing.”
